1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | Decode subtree.
4
5module Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Subtree.Decode
6  ( -- * Decode
7    readSubtreeClauses,
8    subtreeClause,
9    decodeSubtreePattern,
10
11    -- * Syntax of subtree
12    -- $Syntax
13  ) where
14
15import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture                as O
16import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base                    as B
17import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Subtext                 as U
18import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Symbol           as S
19import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Token            as S
20import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Tree             as S
21import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Subtree.Subtree  as S
22import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Token.Pattern    as P
23import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Tree.Pattern     as P
24import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.Message            as Msg
25
26-- | Read subtree clauses from file.
27--
28--   >>> mapM_ (S.printToks . B.clauseTokens) O.# B.abortLeft O.# readSubtreeClauses "subtree.txt"
29--   ********** > "a1"
30--   TText /0.10.0/ TextRaw ">"
31--   TText /0.10.2/ TextQQ "a1"
32--   TOpen /0.0.0/ "("
33--   TText /0.11.2/ TextRaw "-"
34--   TText /0.11.4/ TextQQ "bb"
35--   TText /0.0.0/ TextRaw "|"
36--   TText /0.12.2/ TextRaw "-"
37--   TText /0.12.4/ TextQQ "cc"
38--   TClose /0.0.0/ ")"
39--
40readSubtreeClauses :: FilePath -> B.IOAb [S.TokenClause String]
41readSubtreeClauses path =
42    do ls' <- S.readClauses path
43       return $ case ls' of
44         Left a -> Left a
45         Right ls -> subtreeClause O.<#> ls
46
47-- | Insert open\/sep\/close to subtree clause.
48subtreeClause :: S.TokenClause String -> B.Ab (S.TokenClause String)
49subtreeClause cl = cl' where
50    cl' = case clauseFirstElem cl of
51            Just (P.TRaw s) | s `elem` [">", ">>"] ->
52                do toks <- branch (B.lineTokens <$> B.clauseLines cl)
53                   Right $ cl { B.clauseTokens = S.sweepToken $ concat toks }
54            _ -> Right cl
55
56    branch = B.indentBranch size test open sep close
57
58    size (S.TSpace _ n) = Just n
59    size _              = Nothing
60
61    test (P.TRaw s) = s `elem` [">", ">>", "-", "+"]
62    test _          = False
63
64    open   = S.TOpen  B.def "("
65    sep    = S.TText  B.def S.TextRaw "||"
66    close  = S.TClose B.def ")"
67
68clauseFirstElem :: B.CodeClause k t -> Maybe (k t)
69clauseFirstElem cl =
70    case B.clauseLines cl of
71      [] -> Nothing
72      ln : _ -> case B.lineTokens ln of
73                  [] -> Nothing
74                  tok : _ -> Just tok
75
76-- | Decode token trees to subtree patterns.
77--
78--   >>> S.withTrees decodeSubtreePattern "- \"Z1\""
79--   Right [SubtreeL SubtreeNone (SivmapEq "Z1")]
80--
81--   >>> S.withTrees decodeSubtreePattern "> \"Y1\" ( - \"Z1\" )"
82--   Right [SubtreeB SubtreeNone (SivmapEq "Y1") [SubtreeL SubtreeNone (SivmapEq "Z1")]]
83--
84--   >>> S.withTrees decodeSubtreePattern "> \"Y1\" ( - \"Z1\" || - \"Z2\" )"
85--   Right [SubtreeB SubtreeNone (SivmapEq "Y1")
86--            [SubtreeL SubtreeNone (SivmapEq "Z1"),
87--             SubtreeL SubtreeNone (SivmapEq "Z2")]]
88--
89--   >>> S.withTrees decodeSubtreePattern ">> \"Y1\" ( - \"Z1\" )"
90--   Right [SubtreeR (SivmapEq "Y1") [SubtreeL SubtreeNone (SivmapEq "Z1")]]
91--
92--   >>> S.withTrees decodeSubtreePattern ">> \"Y1\" ( - A B /z \"Z1\" )"
93--   Right [SubtreeR (SivmapEq "Y1") [SubtreeL (SubtreeText ["A","B"] (TermName EQ "z")) (SivmapEq "Z1")]]
94--
95decodeSubtreePattern :: [S.Tree] -> B.Ab [S.SubtreePattern]
96decodeSubtreePattern = pats where
97    pats ts = pat O.<#> S.divideTreesByBar2 ts
98
99    pat (P.LRaw "-" : ts) = do (ts', term) <- splitClassTerm ts
100                               (f, _) <- filtPat ts'
101                               Right $ S.SubtreeL term f
102    pat (P.LRaw ">" : ts) = do (ts', term) <- splitClassTerm ts
103                               S.SubtreeB term </> ts'
104    pat (P.LRaw ">>" : ts) = S.SubtreeR </> ts
105    pat ts = abSubtree ts $ Msg.adlib "Unknown subtree pattern"
106
107    k </> ts = do (f, ps) <- filtPat ts
108                  Right $ k f ps
109
110    filtPat ts = abSubtree ts $ case splitFilter ts of
111        (fs, [P.BGroup ts2])
112                 -> do fs' <- filt O.<#> fs
113                       ps <- pats ts2
114                       Right (mconcat fs', ps)
115        (fs, []) -> do fs' <- filt O.<#> fs
116                       Right (mconcat fs', [])
117        (_, ts2) -> abSubtree ts2 $ Msg.adlib "Malformed subtree pattern"
118
119    filt :: [S.Tree] -> B.Ab (U.Sivmap String)
120    filt []                      = Right $ U.sivmapId
121    filt [P.LQq s]               = Right $ U.sivmapEq s
122    filt [P.LRaw "?", P.LQq s]   = Right $ U.sivmapKeep s
123    filt [P.LRaw "!", P.LQq s]   = Right $ U.sivmapOmit s
124    filt [P.LQq n, P.LRaw "=", P.LQq v]  = Right $ U.sivmapAssoc n v
125    filt ts = abSubtree ts $ Msg.adlib "Unknown subtree filter"
126
127splitFilter :: [S.Tree] -> ([[S.Tree]], [S.Tree])
128splitFilter ts = (filt', pat) where
129    (filt, pat) = break isGroup ts
130    filt' = S.divideTreesByBar filt
131
132    isGroup (P.BGroup _) = True
133    isGroup _            = False
134
135splitClassTerm :: [S.Tree] -> B.Ab ([S.Tree], S.SubtreeTerm)
136splitClassTerm ts0 = abSubtree ts0 $ loop [] ts0 where
137    loop cs (P.LRaw c : ts)  = loop (c : cs) ts
138    loop cs (P.LTerm n : P.LRaw "seq" : ts)
139        = right cs (ts, S.SubtreeSeq (reverse cs) (S.toTermName n))
140    loop cs (P.LTerm n : ts)
141        = right cs (ts, S.subtreeTexts (reverse cs) (S.toTermName n))
142    loop _ _ = Right (ts0, S.SubtreeNone)
143
144    right cs result
145        | null cs    = Msg.adlib "Expect one or more judgement classes"
146        | otherwise  = Right result
147
148-- | Abortable scope for subtree.
149abSubtree :: (B.GetCodePos cp) => B.Abortable cp b
150abSubtree = B.abortable "subtree"
151
152-- $Syntax
153--
154-- == Pattern
155--
156--  [@-@ /Filter/]
157--    Leaf which satisfies /Filter/.
158--  [@>@ /Filter/ @{@ /Pattern/ @|@ ... @}@]
159--    Branch which satisfies /Filter/,
160--    and inner trees match /Pattern/.
161--  [@>>@ /Filter/ @{@ /Pattern/ @|@ ... @}@]
162--    Recursive branch pattern include current branch,
163--    and inner trees match /Pattern/.
164--  [@>>>@ /Filter/ @{@ /Pattern/ @|@ ... @}@]
165--    Recursive branch pattern only inner branches,
166--    and inner trees match /Pattern/.
167--
168-- == Filter
169--
170--  [/Element/ @|@ ...]
171--    Chain of filter /Element/s.
172--
173-- == Element
174--
175--  [@"@/Text/@"@]
176--    Node name is equal to /Text/.
177--  [@?@ @"@/Like/@"@]
178--    Node name satisfies /Like/ pattern.
179--  [@!@ @"@/Like/@"@]
180--    Node name does not satisfies /Like/ pattern.
181--  [@id@ @"@/Text/@"@]
182--    __Used for XML tree:__
183--    Value of id attribute is equal to /Text/.
184--  [@class@ @"@/Text/@"@]
185--    __Used for XML tree:__
186--    Space-delimited values of class attribute contains /Text/.
187--  [@"@/Text/@"@ @=@ @"@/Text/@"@]
188--    __Used for XML tree:__
189--    Attribute value is equal to /Text/.
190--
